message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for a great price. I think you'll really love it!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I have to make a living. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get at least $140 for the product. Can you consider that?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $140 is still a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. Can we meet in the middle again?
I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $135. That's the lowest I can go. Can you meet me at $135?
I'm getting close to your price, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I can do $132, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me at $132?
I'm not going to go any lower than $135, but I'm willing to throw in a small bonus to sweeten the deal. I'll meet you at $132.50. That's the best I can do.
I appreciate the bonus, but I'm still not sure if I can meet you at $132.50. I can do $131, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me at $131?
I'm not going to go any lower than $135, and I've already thrown in a bonus to sweeten the deal. I'm willing to meet you at $132.50, but I'm not budging from that. It's take it or leave it.

I've made it clear that I'm not willing to go above $131, and I'm not interested in playing games. I'm willing to walk away and buy the product from John for $150. I'm not going to engage in any further negotiations. The offer is final.
